body.name: Saving her Marriage to the Duke: A Historical Regency Romance Novel (Brides of Convenience Book 2)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars They are perfect for each other
reviews.reviewText: He abandoned her just after their wedding.she wants him to come back.But as always there is a secret,an enemy and some one who is willing to destroy her reputation to save his reputation

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Rumors in the ton bring about a reunion between a couple that have been apart for 5 years. The story explores how hard it can be to develop trust in a relationship, especially when others are eager to break any bonds that can develop between the couple.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great characters and interesting plot
reviews.reviewText: The characters were well written. I enjoyed the growing relationship between Evan and Arabella. The main plot regarding Evan wanting to verify Arabella's alleged infidelity was very entertaining. There were a few interesting surprises that kept the book fresh.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars And the Winner takes all
reviews.reviewText: Wonderful story, great staory line, and characters who will steal your heart. A sad Duchess, a broken Duke, a rake of a brother in law, a sister in law, and a brother full of fun, and a Dowager Duchess, spent on evil. When truth and secrets collide,Evan and Arabella will come together and fight for love. Thank you ♥️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I did like Evan and Arabella together, but initially I thought her attitude was counterproductive to her having the relationship that she desired with her husband. She was letting her pride overrule the necessity to tell him the truth. I didn’t like Evan’s cousin Leonard, who was also Arabella’s best friend. He didn’t seem very supportive and helpful when Evan first returned home. The fact that he was willing to use others to cover his own actions made his friendship seem less genuine. I am glad that they had a happy ending and most of the challenges were saved fairly quickly. I don’t like when things drag on and it takes forever for the happy ending.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can a marriage on the brink of disaster be saved?
reviews.reviewText: Arabella, Duchess of Lancaster, is rumoured to be inviting willing males to her bed. Although nothing could be further from the truth, her husband in name only is persuaded/ bullied into returning to London to "deal with the problem" by his rather unpleasant and overbearing grandmother.Having been more or less forced into marriage with Arabella Evan left for his estate immediately after the wedding without consummating it, and has kept himself away from London and his wife for the past five years, but is now forced into her company. The problem was never that he didn't like his wife, but that he found her attractive, and having lost his first wife and his son, he has no wish to love again or to start a family.I enjoyed the story a lot, especially how the couple actually communicated with each other after a few false starts. I didn't suspect who the real villain was or that they would be so dastardly, and neither did I suspect who the person spreading the false rumours was either.The reason for four stars instead of five is the lack of proof reading which would have caught errors like the H suddenly being called Edward, the incorrect use of words and incorrect spelling.I received an ARC from the author but this is my honest opinion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved this story and I loved the fact in took a scandal about his wife for the Duke to come to his wife of five years to be sure the rumors were not true. But after coming there he found what a loving and caring person his wife was to everyone including the kindness she show the servants. The Duke (Evan) did not want to fall in love with his wife (Arabella) but in the in that’s exactly what happened, he fell in love with his wife. It was discovered that the rumor was started by her husband’s cousin (Leonard) to cover the fact of his sexual preference. But the most important thing is that their reunion leading them to happily ever after. This is a story worth reading to find out what are the other cliffhangers in this book. Please pick one up and read it , you will enjoy it and be happy you did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The story line is great. It did not drone on like books repeating everything over and over. The characters are great. My favorite thing about this book is that the story flowed perfectly. Looking forward to reading more from this authir.

reviews.reviewTitle: Saving Her Mariage to the Duke
reviews.reviewText: An interesting story which I enjoyed. Looking forward to Book 3 & 4 in the series

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: WOW LOVED THIS BRILLIANT CHARACTERS STEAMY IN PARTS HEARTBREAKING IN OTHERS A MUST READ
reviews.reviewText: EVAN GARTER DUKE OF LANCASTER - Cut himself off from society after the death of his wife Anna in childbirth also looking the baby. His grandmother The Dowager Dutchess has demanded that remarry and has chosen a bride for him - Evan agreed but is determined it will not be a love match and will not have children.LADY ARABELLA - A caring young lady and looks forward to her marriage, she is already in love with him, after the wedding she realises her husband had no intention of going to her.Evan arranges for her to live in the London Home - five years later their is gossip about his wife's activities in London GLORIA offers him to sort his wife out.ALL IS NOT AS IT SEEMS - THIS IS A BRILLIANT LOVE STORY WITH OTHER MAIN CHARACTERS ALL AS INTERESTING AS EVAN AND ARABELLA WITH THEIR OWN STORIES. LOTS OF SURPRISES SOME NOT SO NICE NOT EVERYONE IS WANTING A HAPPY ENDING .LOVED ITI RECEIVED AN ARC COPY

I really enjoyed reading this book. The characters are believable. I can feel the simmering friction and disguised attraction between the H and h. I lament the weak character that the H projects. It seems he doesn't know his own mind, nor trust his own decisions so that he comes out as weak. The h on the other hand has more patience than a saint. She went through 5 years without seeing her husband and was prepared to spend more if that was what he wanted! I would not have tolerated any separation arrangement like that. I mean it's just crazy! At last in the end, the H seem to grow a spine and was able to work out that he was the Duke and has power instead of being a child that needed to be told what to do. There are a lot of Steam in this story. Notwithstanding some of the flaws of the main characters, I enjoyed reading this book. The author did a wonderful job of keeping me glued page after page. I like these Kindle Historical Romance books. They are not overly long and can be read in an hour or two. Perfect for a lazy afternoon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Saving her Marriage to the Duke
reviews.reviewText: A good read . A bit too long waiting ( I don't think loyalty could last). But thanks to the interesting storylines and to the enchanting characters it jelled, helped by being written with skill.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Saving her Marriage to the Duke
reviews.reviewText: There are 3 books in this series and I read them all as they were very good books. I would recommend the author and the storylines in the books.
